item.title: Creamy Green Bean Casserole That Everyone Will Love!
item.description: Creamy green bean casserole, a classic dish that brings warmth to any gathering! Loaded with fresh green beans, a rich sauce, and crispy onions on top. Great for family dinners or holiday feasts. Save this for your next celebration! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230166734 #Easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
  • 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup (I use Campbell's)
  • 1/2 cup milk (any kind works, I like whole milk)
  • 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (I always use Tillamook)
  • 1 cup crispy fried onions (like French's)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Get that warmth going while you prep!
  2. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the green beans for about 5 minutes until they're bright green but still crisp. Drain and set aside.
  3. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the cream of mushroom soup and milk until smooth. Add in the cheddar cheese and stir until blended. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  4. Combine the cooked green beans with the soup mixture in a large casserole dish. Mix until the beans are well coated.
  5. Top the casserole with crispy fried onions. You can either sprinkle them on lightly or pile them high (I usually go for high!).
  6. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the edges are bubbly and the top is golden brown. Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375Â°F (190Â°C). That's the sweet spot for baking this tart.

item.title: Decadent Chocolate Yule Log Recipe for Festive Celebrations
item.description: Rich chocolate yule log that's a must-have for holiday gatherings! Featuring a moist chocolate sponge layered with creamy filling, itâ€™s a treat everyone will love. Ideal for festive occasions with family and friends. Don't forget to save this recipe for later! | â±ï¸ Prep: 30min | Cook: 25min | Serves: 8 | #Mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 25 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 large eggs, separated
  • 1 cup granulated sugar, divided
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 1/3 cup cocoa powder, unsweetened (like Ghirardelli)
  • 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup heavy cream (use Organic Valley for best results)
  • 1/4 cup powdered sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Chocolate shavings, for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Line a 15x10-inch baking pan with parchment paper, letting some hang over the edges. This makes it easier to lift out later.
  2. In a mixing bowl, beat the egg yolks with half the sugar until pale and thick. This step is crucial for that fluffy texture.
  3. Sift the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt into the yolk mixture. Gently fold until just combined, being careful not to overmix.
  4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until foamy, then gradually add the remaining sugar. Whip until stiff peaks form. Fold a third of the whites into the chocolate mixture, then gently fold in the remaining whites. You want to keep it light!
  5. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cake springs back when lightly pressed. It should look set but not dry.
  6. Once out of the oven, let it cool in the pan for about 5 minutes. Then, invert it onto a clean kitchen towel dusted with powdered sugar. Carefully peel off the parchment. Roll it up with the towel from the short side and let it cool completely.

  1. OK, so first things first, preheat your oven to 325Â°F. While that's heating up, let's prep the turkey. Rinse it under cold water and pat it dry with paper towels. Season it generously with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika.

  3. Flip the turkey and pour in 2 cups of chicken broth. Cover with foil and roast for about 2 hours. Check for doneness; it should reach 165Â°F in the thickest part. Trust me, you want to avoid undercooked turkey.
  4. While the turkey is roasting, heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sautÃ© until translucent, then throw in the garlic and collard greens. Cook until the greens are wilted, about 10 minutes.
  5. Season the collards with salt and pepper, then add a splash of chicken broth if they seem dry. Let them simmer while the turkey finishes up. And don't forget to whip up that cornbread - easy peasy with Bob's Red Mill cornmeal.

item.title: No-Bake Berry Trifle Cake: Fresh Layers of Yum!
item.description: This no-bake berry trifle cake is a total win for gatherings! With layers of fluffy cake, creamy pudding, and fresh berries, it's a fun twist on dessert. Serve it at your next BBQ or family get-together. Trust me, youâ€™ll want to save this recipe! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 15min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230221583 #Easyrecipe #quickrecipe #30minutemeals #recipe
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 15 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 box of vanilla pudding mix (like Jell-O)
  • 2 cups cold milk
  • 1 pound of fresh mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
  • 1 store-bought pound cake, cut into slices
  • 1 cup whipped cream (I use Cool Whip)
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Mint leaves for garnish (optional)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the vanilla pudding mix and cold milk until it thickens, about 2 minutes. Set aside.
  2. In another bowl, fold the whipped cream into the pudding mixture gently, adding the vanilla extract too. You want it to be fluffy and light.
  3. Grab a trifle dish or a large glass bowl. Start layering! First, place a layer of cake slices at the bottom, then spread some pudding mixture.
  4. Next, add a layer of mixed berries. Repeat the layers until you've used everything up, finishing with pudding on top.
  5. Chill in the fridge for about 15 minutes to set. This helps the flavors blend nicely!
  6. Before serving, top with extra berries and mint leaves for a pop of color.

item.title: Chocolate Pecan Pie That's So Easy to Make
item.description: Rich, chocolate pecan pie ready in just 45 minutes! With a flaky crust and a gooey, chocolaty filling, this dessert is a total hit at every gathering. Great for family dinners or holiday celebrations. Save this recipe for your next sweet craving! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 8 | #Mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 pre-made pie crust (store-bought or homemade)
  • 1 cup pecans, chopped
  • 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips (I like Ghirardelli)
  • 3/4 cup brown sugar, packed
  • 1/4 cup corn syrup
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter (Kerrygold works great), melted

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). This is key for getting that crust nice and golden.
  2. In a mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, brown sugar, and corn syrup. Whisk it all together until smooth.
  3. Add in the eggs, vanilla extract, and salt. Mix until everything is well combined. Trust me, it's gonna smell so good!
  4. Fold in the chopped pecans and chocolate chips, making sure they get evenly distributed.
  5. Pour the filling into the pie crust, spreading it out evenly. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until the center is set but still slightly jiggly.
  6. Let it cool for at least 15 minutes before slicing. It's gonna be hard to resist, but trust me, itâ€™s worth the wait.
